intro: Caldasia lasiopetala, commonly known as the woolly leaf caldasia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring.
